intro: Pentadesma leucantha, commonly known as white ghost tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is often found in moist, lowland areas and can grow up to 20 meters in height. Its latex is milky and contains toxic compounds, which serve as a natural defense mechanism. The species is also valued for its timber and has cultural significance in some regions.
